author: cnbc.com
title: AutoWeb: 1Q Earnings Snapshot
text:
IRVINE, Calif. (AP) _ AutoWeb Inc. (AUTO) on Thursday reported a first-quarter loss of $10.3 million, after reporting a profit in the same period a year earlier.
On a per-share basis, the Irvine, California-based company said it had a loss of 81 cents. Losses, adjusted for one-time gains and costs, were 7 cents per share.
The provider of marketing services for automakers and dealers posted revenue of $32.3 million in the period.
In the final minutes of trading on Thursday, the company's shares hit $3.70. A year ago, they were trading at $12.43.
This story was generated by Automated Insights ( http://automatedinsights.com/ap ) using data from Zacks Investment Research. Access a Zacks stock report on AUTO at https://www.zacks.com/ap/AUTO
